messages.messageBody:

curtkar@... writes:

> There was a Todd on this list a few months ago and his wife was named Ren.
>

GOSH, what a coincidence. I wonder if they are the same folks..

Ren????

Teresa

messages.messageBody:
There was a Todd on this list a few months ago and his wife was named Ren.

Karin




----- Original Message -----
From: <grlynbl@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, December 30, 2002 9:32 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] This lively group


> Hey, Ren, is your Dh name Todd? There are a Todd and Ren on the
> Stillwater/homestead group that homeschool thier children. I was just
> wonderin....:-)
>
> Teresa

messages.subject: Re: This lively group
messages.msgSnippet: ... Me too Ren! (on that list as well) they don t get it do they? Not that I m any great unschooling saintly mum or anything, I struggle with it on a daily
messages.messageBody:
>Still here.
>I've just been trying to figure out another group that >apparently sees any
>disagreement as lacking in harmony and disruptive to the >list.
>Thank goodness for unschooling.com or I'd go crazy!!


Me too Ren! (on that list as well) they don't 'get it' do they? Not that I'm
any great unschooling saintly mum or anything, I struggle with it on a daily
basis.

Elaine (UK)

yunno the more I read the more I think we need a truly international
organisation to actively support unschooling or even home schooling (we call
it all home education in the UK).
I think we need an org with some money in it so we can hire people if needed
and also produce some paper copies of information. I really feel that with
globalisation is coming the undermining of the 'rights' of children and
their parents, especially with regard to unschooling.

messages.subject: This lively group
messages.msgSnippet: Still here. I ve just been trying to figure out another group that apparently sees any disagreement as lacking in harmony and disruptive to the list. Thank
messages.messageBody:
Still here.
I've just been trying to figure out another group that apparently sees any
disagreement as lacking in harmony and disruptive to the list.
Thank goodness for unschooling.com or I'd go crazy!!

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
